undefined Reveal your light and your faithfulness!They will lead me,they will escort me back to your holy hill,and to the place where you live.
undefined Then I will go to the altar of God,to the God who gives me ecstatic joy,so that I express my thanks to you, O God, my God, with a harp.

undefined Why are you depressed, O my soul?Why are you upset?Wait for God!For I will again give thanksto my God for his saving intervention.Psalm 44For the music director; by the Korahites, a well-written song.
O God, we have clearly heard;our ancestors have told uswhat you did in their days,in ancient times.
undefined You, by your power, defeated nations and settled our fathers on their land;you crushed the people living there and enabled our ancestors to occupy it.
undefined For they did not conquer the land by their swords,and they did not prevail by their strength,but rather by your power, strength and good favor,for you were partial to them.
undefined You are my king, O God!Decree Jacob’s deliverance!
undefined By your power we will drive back our enemies;by your strength we will trample down our foes!
undefined For I do not trust in my bow,and I do not prevail by my sword.
undefined For you deliver us from our enemies;you humiliate those who hate us.
undefined In God I boast all day long,and we will continually give thanks to your name. (Selah)
undefined But you rejected and embarrassed us!You did not go into battle with our armies.
undefined You made us retreat from the enemy.Those who hate us take whatever they want from us.
undefined You handed us over like sheep to be eaten;you scattered us among the nations.
undefined You sold your people for a pittance;you did not ask a high price for them.
undefined You made us an object of disdain to our neighbors;those who live on our borders taunt and insult us.
undefined You made us an object of ridicule among the nations;foreigners treat us with contempt.
undefined All day long I feel humiliatedand am overwhelmed with shame,
undefined before the vindictive enemywho ridicules and insults me.
undefined All this has happened to us, even though we have not rejected youor violated your covenant with us.
undefined We have not been unfaithful,nor have we disobeyed your commands.
undefined Yet you have battered us, leaving us a heap of ruins overrun by wild dogs;you have covered us with darkness.
undefined If we had rejected our God,and spread out our hands in prayer to another god,
undefined would not God discover it,for he knows one’s thoughts?
undefined Yet because of you we are killed all day long;we are treated like sheep at the slaughtering block.
undefined Rouse yourself! Why do you sleep, O Lord?Wake up! Do not reject us forever!
undefined Why do you look the other way,and ignore the way we are oppressed and mistreated?
undefined For we lie in the dirt,with our bellies pressed to the ground.
undefined Rise up and help us!Rescue us because of your loyal love!Psalm 45For the music director; according to the tune of “Lilies;” by the Korahites, a well-written poem, a love song.
My heart is stirred by a beautiful song.I say, “I have composed this special song for the king;my tongue is as skilled as the stylus of an experienced scribe.”
undefined You are the most handsome of all men!You speak in an impressive and fitting manner!For this reason God grants you continual blessings.
undefined Strap your sword to your thigh, O warrior!Appear in your majestic splendor!
undefined Appear in your majesty and be victorious!Ride forth for the sake of what is right,on behalf of justice!Then your right hand will accomplish mighty acts!
undefined Your arrows are sharpand penetrate the hearts of the king’s enemies.Nations fall at your feet.
undefined Your throne, O God, is permanent.The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of justice.
undefined You love justice and hate evil.For this reason God, your God has anointed youwith the oil of joy, elevating you above your companions.
undefined All your garments are perfumed with myrrh, aloes, and cassia.From the luxurious palaces comes the music of stringed instruments that makes you happy.
undefined Princesses are among your honored guests,your bride stands at your right hand, wearing jewelry made with gold from Ophir.
undefined Listen, O princess!Observe and pay attention!Forget your homeland and your family!
undefined Then the king will be attracted by your beauty.After all, he is your master! Submit to him!
undefined Rich people from Tyrewill seek your favor by bringing a gift.
undefined The princess looks absolutely magnificent,decked out in pearls and clothed in a brocade trimmed with gold.
undefined In embroidered robes she is escorted to the king.Her attendants, the maidens of honor who follow her,are led before you.
undefined They are bubbling with joy as they walk in processionand enter the royal palace.
undefined Your sons will carry on the dynasty of your ancestors;you will make them princes throughout the land.
undefined I will proclaim your greatness through the coming years,then the nations will praise you forever.Psalm 46For the music director; by the Korahites; according to the alamoth style; a song.
God is our strong refuge;he is truly our helper in times of trouble.
undefined For this reason we do not fear when the earth shakes,and the mountains tumble into the depths of the sea,
undefined when its waves crash and foam,and the mountains shake before the surging sea. (Selah)
undefined The river’s channels bring joy to the city of God,the special, holy dwelling place of the sovereign One.
undefined God lives within it, it cannot be moved.God rescues it at the break of dawn.
undefined Nations are in uproar, kingdoms are overthrown.God gives a shout, the earth dissolves.
undefined The LORD who commands armies is on our side!The God of Jacob is our protector! (Selah)
undefined Come! Witness the exploits of the LORD,who brings devastation to the earth!
undefined He brings an end to wars throughout the earth;he shatters the bow and breaks the spear;he burns the shields with fire.
undefined He says, “Stop your striving and recognize that I am God!I will be exalted over the nations! I will be exalted over the earth!”
undefined The LORD who commands armies is on our side!The God of Jacob is our protector! (Selah)Psalm 47For the music director; by the Korahites; a psalm.
All you nations, clap your hands!Shout out to God in celebration!
undefined For the sovereign LORD is awe-inspiring;he is the great king who rules the whole earth!
undefined He subdued nations beneath usand countries under our feet.
undefined He picked out for us a special landto be a source of pride for Jacob, whom he loves. (Selah)
undefined God has ascended his throne amid loud shouts;the LORD has ascended his throne amid the blaring of ram’s horns.
undefined Sing to God! Sing!Sing to our king! Sing!
undefined For God is king of the whole earth!Sing a well-written song!
undefined God reigns over the nations!God sits on his holy throne!

undefined The nobles of the nations assemble,along with the people of the God of Abraham,for God has authority over the rulers of the earth.He is highly exalted!Psalm 48A song, a psalm by the Korahites.
The LORD is great and certainly worthy of praisein the city of our God, his holy hill.
undefined It is lofty and pleasing to look at,a source of joy to the whole earth.Mount Zion resembles the peaks of Zaphon;it is the city of the great king.
undefined God is in its fortresses;he reveals himself as its defender.
undefined For look, the kings assemble;they advance together.
undefined As soon as they see, they are shocked;they are terrified, they quickly retreat.
undefined Look at them shake uncontrollably,like a woman writhing in childbirth.
undefined With an east windyou shatter the large ships.
undefined We heard about God’s mighty deeds, now we have seen them,in the city of the LORD, the invincible Warrior,in the city of our God.God makes it permanently secure. (Selah)
undefined We reflect on your loyal love, O God,within your temple.
undefined The praise you receive as far away as the ends of the earthis worthy of your reputation, O God.You execute justice!
undefined Mount Zion rejoices;the towns of Judah are happy,because of your acts of judgment.
undefined Walk around Zion! Encircle it!Count its towers!
undefined Consider its defenses!Walk through its fortresses,so you can tell the next generation about it!
undefined For God, our God, is our defender forever!He guides us!Psalm 49For the music director, a psalm by the Korahites.
Listen to this, all you nations!Pay attention, all you inhabitants of the world!
undefined Pay attention, all you people,both rich and poor!
undefined I will declare a wise saying;I will share my profound thoughts.
undefined I will learn a song that imparts wisdom;I will then sing my insightful song to the accompaniment of a harp.
undefined Why should I be afraid in times of trouble,when the sinful deeds of deceptive men threaten to overwhelm me?
undefined They trust in their wealthand boast in their great riches.
undefined Certainly a man cannot rescue his brother;he cannot pay God an adequate ransom price
undefined (the ransom price for a human life is too high,and people go to their final destiny),
undefined so that he might continue to live foreverand not experience death.
undefined Surely one sees that even wise people die;fools and spiritually insensitive people all pass awayand leave their wealth to others.
undefined Their grave becomes their permanent residence,their eternal dwelling place.They name their lands after themselves,
undefined but, despite their wealth, people do not last,they are like animals that perish.
undefined This is the destiny of fools,and of those who approve of their philosophy. (Selah)

undefined They will travel to Sheol like sheep,with death as their shepherd.The godly will rule over them when the day of vindication dawns;Sheol will consume their bodies and they will no longer live in impressive houses.
undefined But God will rescue my life from the power of Sheol;certainly he will pull me to safety. (Selah)
undefined Do not be afraid when a man becomes richand his wealth multiplies!
undefined For he will take nothing with him when he dies;his wealth will not follow him down into the grave.
undefined He pronounces this blessing on himself while he is alive:“May men praise you, for you have done well!”
undefined But he will join his ancestors;they will never again see the light of day.
undefined Wealthy people do not understand;they are like animals that perish.Psalm 50A psalm by Asaph.
El, God, the LORD speaks,and summons the earth to come from the east and west.
undefined From Zion, the most beautiful of all places,God comes in splendor.
undefined Our God approaches and is not silent;consuming fire goes ahead of himand all around him a storm rages.
undefined He summons the heavens above,as well as the earth, so that he might judge his people.
undefined He says:“Assemble my covenant people before me,those who ratified a covenant with me by sacrifice!”
undefined The heavens declare his fairness,for God is judge. (Selah)
undefined He says:“Listen my people! I am speaking!Listen Israel! I am accusing you!I am God, your God!
undefined I am not condemning you because of your sacrifices,or because of your burnt sacrifices that you continually offer me.
undefined I do not need to take a bull from your householdor goats from your sheepfolds.
undefined For every wild animal in the forest belongs to me,as well as the cattle that graze on a thousand hills.
undefined I keep track of every bird in the hills,and the insects of the field are mine.
undefined Even if I were hungry, I would not tell you,for the world and all it contains belong to me.
undefined Do I eat the flesh of bulls?Do I drink the blood of goats?
undefined Present to God a thank-offering!Repay your vows to the sovereign One!
undefined Pray to me when you are in trouble!I will deliver you, and you will honor me!”
undefined God says this to the evildoer:“How can you declare my commands,and talk about my covenant?
undefined For you hate instructionand reject my words.
undefined When you see a thief, you join him;you associate with men who are unfaithful to their wives.
undefined You do damage with words,and use your tongue to deceive.
undefined You plot against your brother;you slander your own brother.
undefined When you did these things, I was silent,so you thought I was exactly like you.But now I will condemn youand state my case against you!
undefined Carefully consider this, you who reject God!Otherwise I will rip you to shredsand no one will be able to rescue you.

undefined Whoever presents a thank-offering honors me.To whoever obeys my commands, I will reveal my power to deliver.”Psalm 51For the music director; a psalm of David, written when Nathan the prophet confronted him after David’s affair with Bathsheba.
Have mercy on me, O God, because of your loyal love!Because of your great compassion, wipe away my rebellious acts!
undefined Wash away my wrongdoing!Cleanse me of my sin!
undefined For I am aware of my rebellious acts;I am forever conscious of my sin.
undefined Against you – you above all – I have sinned;I have done what is evil in your sight.So you are just when you confront me;you are right when you condemn me.
undefined Look, I was guilty of sin from birth,a sinner the moment my mother conceived me.
undefined Look, you desire integrity in the inner man;you want me to possess wisdom.
undefined Sprinkle me with water and I will be pure;wash me and I will be whiter than snow.
undefined Grant me the ultimate joy of being forgiven!May the bones you crushed rejoice!
undefined Hide your face from my sins!Wipe away all my guilt!
undefined Create for me a pure heart, O God!Renew a resolute spirit within me!
undefined Do not reject me!Do not take your Holy Spirit away from me!
undefined Let me again experience the joy of your deliverance!Sustain me by giving me the desire to obey!
undefined Then I will teach rebels your merciful ways,and sinners will turn to you.
undefined Rescue me from the guilt of murder, O God, the God who delivers me!Then my tongue will shout for joy because of your deliverance.
undefined O Lord, give me the words!Then my mouth will praise you.
undefined Certainly you do not want a sacrifice, or else I would offer it;you do not desire a burnt sacrifice.
undefined The sacrifices God desires are a humble spirit – O God, a humble and repentant heart you will not reject.
undefined Because you favor Zion, do what is good for her!Fortify the walls of Jerusalem!

undefined Then you will accept the proper sacrifices, burnt sacrifices and whole offerings;then bulls will be sacrificed on your altar.Psalm 52For the music director; a well-written song by David. It was written when Doeg the Edomite went and informed Saul: “David has arrived at the home of Ahimelech.”
Why do you boast about your evil plans, O powerful man?God’s loyal love protects me all day long!
undefined Your tongue carries out your destructive plans;it is as effective as a sharp razor, O deceiver.
undefined You love evil more than good,lies more than speaking the truth. (Selah)
undefined You love to use all the words that destroy,and the tongue that deceives.
undefined Yet God will make you a permanent heap of ruins.He will scoop you up and remove you from your home;he will uproot you from the land of the living. (Selah)
undefined When the godly see this, they will be filled with awe,and will mock the evildoer, saying:
undefined “Look, here is the man who would not make God his protector!He trusted in his great wealthand was confident about his plans to destroy others.”
undefined But I am like a flourishing olive tree in the house of God;I continually trust in God’s loyal love.

undefined I will continually thank you when you execute judgment;I will rely on you, for your loyal followers know you are good.Psalm 53For the music director; according to the machalath style; a well-written song by David.
Fools say to themselves, “There is no God.”They sin and commit evil deeds;none of them does what is right.
undefined God looks down from heaven at the human race,to see if there is anyone who is wise and seeks God.
undefined Everyone rejects God;they are all morally corrupt.None of them does what is right,not even one!
undefined All those who behave wickedly do not understand – those who devour my people as if they were eating bread,and do not call out to God.
undefined They are absolutely terrified,even by things that do not normally cause fear.For God annihilates those who attack you.You are able to humiliate them because God has rejected them.

undefined I wish the deliverance of Israel would come from Zion!When God restores the well-being of his people,may Jacob rejoice,may Israel be happy!Psalm 54For the music director, to be accompanied by stringed instruments; a well-written song by David. It was written when the Ziphites came and informed Saul: “David is hiding with us.”
O God, deliver me by your name!Vindicate me by your power!
undefined O God, listen to my prayer!Pay attention to what I say!
undefined For foreigners attack me;ruthless men, who do not respect God, seek my life. (Selah)
undefined Look, God is my deliverer!The Lord is among those who support me.
undefined May those who wait to ambush me be repaid for their evil!As a demonstration of your faithfulness, destroy them!
undefined With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to you!I will give thanks to your name, O LORD, for it is good!
undefined Surely he rescues me from all trouble,and I triumph over my enemies.Psalm 55For the music director, to be accompanied by stringed instruments; a well-written song by David.
Listen, O God, to my prayer!Do not ignore my appeal for mercy!
undefined Pay attention to me and answer me!I am so upset and distressed, I am beside myself,
undefined because of what the enemy says,and because of how the wicked pressure me,for they hurl trouble down upon meand angrily attack me.
undefined My heart beats violently within me;the horrors of death overcome me.
undefined Fear and panic overpower me;terror overwhelms me.
undefined I say, “I wish I had wings like a dove!I would fly away and settle in a safe place!
undefined Look, I will escape to a distant place;I will stay in the wilderness. (Selah)
undefined I will hurry off to a place that is safefrom the strong wind and the gale.”
undefined Confuse them, O Lord!Frustrate their plans!For I see violence and conflict in the city.
undefined Day and night they walk around on its walls,while wickedness and destruction are within it.
undefined Disaster is within it;violence and deceit do not depart from its public square.
undefined Indeed, it is not an enemy who insults me,or else I could bear it;it is not one who hates me who arrogantly taunts me,or else I could hide from him.
undefined But it is you, a man like me,my close friend in whom I confided.
undefined We would share personal thoughts with each other;in God’s temple we would walk together among the crowd.
undefined May death destroy them!May they go down alive into Sheol!For evil is in their dwelling place and in their midst.
undefined As for me, I will call out to God,and the LORD will deliver me.
undefined During the evening, morning, and noontimeI will lament and moan,and he will hear me.
undefined He will rescue me and protect me from those who attack me,even though they greatly outnumber me.
undefined God, the one who has reigned as king from long ago,will hear and humiliate them. (Selah)They refuse to change,and do not fear God.
undefined He attacks his friends;he breaks his solemn promises to them.
undefined His words are as smooth as butter,but he harbors animosity in his heart.His words seem softer than oil,but they are really like sharp swords.
undefined Throw your burden upon the LORD,and he will sustain you.He will never allow the godly to be upended.

undefined But you, O God, will bring them down to the deep Pit.Violent and deceitful people will not live even half a normal lifespan.But as for me, I trust in you.Psalm 56For the music director; according to the yonath-elem-rechovim style; a prayer of David, written when the Philistines captured him in Gath.
Have mercy on me, O God, for men are attacking me!All day long hostile enemies are tormenting me.
undefined Those who anticipate my defeat attack me all day long.Indeed, many are fighting against me, O Exalted One.
undefined When I am afraid,I trust in you.
undefined In God – I boast in his promise – in God I trust, I am not afraid.What can mere men do to me?
undefined All day long they cause me trouble;they make a habit of plotting my demise.
undefined They stalk and lurk;they watch my every step,as they prepare to take my life.
undefined Because they are bent on violence, do not let them escape!In your anger bring down the nations, O God!
undefined You keep track of my misery.Put my tears in your leather container!Are they not recorded in your scroll?
undefined My enemies will turn back when I cry out to you for help;I know that God is on my side.
undefined In God – I boast in his promise – in the LORD – I boast in his promise –
undefined in God I trust, I am not afraid.What can mere men do to me?
undefined I am obligated to fulfill the vows I made to you, O God;I will give you the thank-offerings you deserve,

undefined when you deliver my life from death.You keep my feet from stumbling,so that I might serve God as I enjoy life.Psalm 57For the music director; according to the al-tashcheth style; a prayer of David, written when he fled from Saul into the cave.
Have mercy on me, O God! Have mercy on me!For in you I have taken shelter.In the shadow of your wings I take shelteruntil trouble passes.
undefined I cry out for help to the sovereign God,to the God who vindicates me.
undefined May he send help from heaven and deliver mefrom my enemies who hurl insults! (Selah)May God send his loyal love and faithfulness!
undefined I am surrounded by lions;I lie down among those who want to devour me;men whose teeth are spears and arrows,whose tongues are a sharp sword.
undefined Rise up above the sky, O God!May your splendor cover the whole earth!
undefined They have prepared a net to trap me;I am discouraged.They have dug a pit for me.They will fall into it! (Selah)
undefined I am determined, O God! I am determined!I will sing and praise you!
undefined Awake, my soul!Awake, O stringed instrument and harp!I will wake up at dawn!
undefined I will give you thanks before the nations, O Master!I will sing praises to you before foreigners!
undefined For your loyal love extends beyond the sky,and your faithfulness reaches the clouds.
undefined Rise up above the sky, O God!May your splendor cover the whole earth!Psalm 58For the music director; according to the al-tashcheth style; a prayer of David.
Do you rulers really pronounce just decisions?Do you judge people fairly?
undefined No! You plan how to do what is unjust;you deal out violence in the earth.
undefined The wicked turn aside from birth;liars go astray as soon as they are born.
undefined Their venom is like that of a snake,like a deaf serpent that does not hear,
undefined that does not respond to the magicians,or to a skilled snake-charmer.
undefined O God, break the teeth in their mouths!Smash the jawbones of the lions, O LORD!
undefined Let them disappear like water that flows away!Let them wither like grass!
undefined Let them be like a snail that melts away as it moves along!Let them be like stillborn babies that never see the sun!
undefined Before the kindling is even placed under your pots,he will sweep it away along with both the raw and cooked meat.
undefined The godly will rejoice when they see vengeance carried out;they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.

undefined Then observers will say,“Yes indeed, the godly are rewarded!Yes indeed, there is a God who judges in the earth!”Psalm 59For the music director; according to the al-tashcheth style; a prayer of David, written when Saul sent men to surround his house and murder him.
Deliver me from my enemies, my God!Protect me from those who attack me!
undefined Deliver me from evildoers!Rescue me from violent men!
undefined For look, they wait to ambush me;powerful men stalk me,but not because I have rebelled or sinned, O LORD.
undefined Though I have done nothing wrong, they are anxious to attack.Spring into action and help me! Take notice of me!
undefined You, O LORD God, the invincible warrior, the God of Israel,rouse yourself and punish all the nations!Have no mercy on any treacherous evildoers! (Selah)
undefined They return in the evening;they growl like a dogand prowl around outside the city.
undefined Look, they hurl insults at meand openly threaten to kill me,for they say,“Who hears?”
undefined But you, O LORD, laugh in disgust at them;you taunt all the nations.
undefined You are my source of strength! I will wait for you!For God is my refuge.
undefined The God who loves me will help me;God will enable me to triumph over my enemies.
undefined Do not strike them dead suddenly,because then my people might forget the lesson.Use your power to make them homeless vagabonds and then bring them down,O Lord who shields us!
undefined They speak sinful words.So let them be trapped by their own prideand by the curses and lies they speak!
undefined Angrily wipe them out! Wipe them out so they vanish!Let them know that God rulesin Jacob and to the ends of the earth! (Selah)
undefined They return in the evening;they growl like a dogand prowl around outside the city.
undefined They wander around looking for something to eat;they refuse to sleep until they are full.
undefined As for me, I will sing about your strength;I will praise your loyal love in the morning.For you are my refugeand my place of shelter when I face trouble.

undefined You are my source of strength! I will sing praises to you!For God is my refuge, the God who loves me.Psalm 60For the music director; according to the shushan-eduth style; a prayer of David written to instruct others. It was written when he fought against Aram Naharaim and Aram-Zobah. That was when Joab turned back and struck down 12,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
O God, you have rejected us.You suddenly turned on us in your anger.Please restore us!
undefined You made the earth quake; you split it open.Repair its breaches, for it is ready to fall.
undefined You have made your people experience hard times;you have made us drink intoxicating wine.
undefined You have given your loyal followers a rallying flag,so that they might seek safety from the bow. (Selah)
undefined Deliver by your power and answer me,so that the ones you love may be safe.
undefined God has spoken in his sanctuary:“I will triumph! I will parcel out Shechem;the Valley of Succoth I will measure off.
undefined Gilead belongs to me,as does Manasseh!Ephraim is my helmet,Judah my royal scepter.
undefined Moab is my washbasin.I will make Edom serve me.I will shout in triumph over Philistia.”
undefined Who will lead me into the fortified city?Who will bring me to Edom?
undefined Have you not rejected us, O God?O God, you do not go into battle with our armies.
undefined Give us help against the enemy,for any help men might offer is futile.
undefined By God’s power we will conquer;he will trample down our enemies.Psalm 61For the music director; to be played on a stringed instrument; written by David.
O God, hear my cry for help!Pay attention to my prayer!
undefined From the most remote place on earthI call out to you in my despair.Lead me up to an inaccessible rocky summit!
undefined Indeed, you are my shelter,a strong tower that protects me from the enemy.
undefined I will be a permanent guest in your home;I will find shelter in the protection of your wings. (Selah)
undefined For you, O God, hear my vows;you grant me the reward that belongs to your loyal followers.
undefined Give the king long life!Make his lifetime span several generations!
undefined May he reign forever before God!Decree that your loyal love and faithfulness should protect him.
undefined Then I will sing praises to your name continually,as I fulfill my vows day after day.Psalm 62For the music director, Jeduthun; a psalm of David.
For God alone I patiently wait;he is the one who delivers me.
undefined He alone is my protector and deliverer.He is my refuge; I will not be upended.
undefined How long will you threaten a man?All of you are murderers,as dangerous as a leaning wall or an unstable fence.
undefined They spend all their time planning how to bring him down.They love to use deceit;they pronounce blessings with their mouths,but inwardly they utter curses. (Selah)
undefined Patiently wait for God alone, my soul!For he is the one who gives me confidence.
undefined He alone is my protector and deliverer.He is my refuge; I will not be upended.
undefined God delivers me and exalts me;God is my strong protector and my shelter.
undefined Trust in him at all times, you people!Pour out your hearts before him!God is our shelter! (Selah)
undefined Men are nothing but a mere breath;human beings are unreliable.When they are weighed in the scales,all of them together are lighter than air.
undefined Do not trust in what you can gain by oppression!Do not put false confidence in what you can gain by robbery!If wealth increases, do not become attached to it!
undefined God has declared one principle;two principles I have heard:God is strong,
undefined and you, O Lord, demonstrate loyal love.For you repay men for what they do.Psalm 63A psalm of David, written when he was in the Judean wilderness.
O God, you are my God! I long for you!My soul thirsts for you,my flesh yearns for you,in a dry and parched land where there is no water.
undefined Yes, in the sanctuary I have seen you,and witnessed your power and splendor.
undefined Because experiencing your loyal love is better than life itself,my lips will praise you.
undefined For this reason I will praise you while I live;in your name I will lift up my hands.
undefined As if with choice meat you satisfy my soul.My mouth joyfully praises you,
undefined whenever I remember you on my bed,and think about you during the nighttime hours.
undefined For you are my deliverer;under your wings I rejoice.
undefined My soul pursues you;your right hand upholds me.
undefined Enemies seek to destroy my life,but they will descend into the depths of the earth.
undefined Each one will be handed over to the sword;their corpses will be eaten by jackals.
undefined But the king will rejoice in God;everyone who takes oaths in his name will boast,for the mouths of those who speak lies will be shut up.Psalm 64For the music director; a psalm of David.
Listen to me, O God, as I offer my lament!Protect my life from the enemy’s terrifying attacks.
undefined Hide me from the plots of evil men,from the crowd of evildoers.
undefined They sharpen their tongues like a sword;they aim their arrow, a slanderous charge,
undefined in order to shoot down the innocent in secluded places.They shoot at him suddenly and are unafraid of retaliation.
undefined They encourage one another to carry out their evil deed.They plan how to hide snares,and boast, “Who will see them?”
undefined They devise unjust schemes;they disguise a well-conceived plot.Man’s inner thoughts cannot be discovered.
undefined But God will shoot at them;suddenly they will be wounded by an arrow.
undefined Their slander will bring about their demise.All who see them will shudder,
undefined and all people will fear.They will proclaim what God has done,and reflect on his deeds.
undefined The godly will rejoice in the LORDand take shelter in him.All the morally upright will boast.Psalm 65For the music director; a psalm of David, a song.
Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion.Vows made to you are fulfilled.
undefined You hear prayers;all people approach you.
undefined Our record of sins overwhelms me,but you forgive our acts of rebellion.
undefined How blessed is the one whom you choose,and allow to live in your palace courts.May we be satisfied with the good things of your house – your holy palace.
undefined You answer our prayers by performing awesome acts of deliverance,O God, our savior.All the ends of the earth trust in you,as well as those living across the wide seas.
undefined You created the mountains by your power,and demonstrated your strength.
